data.title: 35 songs you didn't know Ed Sheeran had written for other artists
data.meta_description: Pop sensation Ed Sheeran has not only stormed the charts with his own songs, but he's also written plenty of hit songs for other artists too.
data.text:
Ed Sheeran is one of the biggest names in pop music. Not only is he constantly topping the charts with some hugely catchy tracks of his own, some of which he almost didn't release, and some pretty incredible collaborations, he's also working behind the scenes with other artists on their music!

There are plenty of songs released by other artists that Ed Sheeran has co-written too, working with the likes of Taylor Swift, Justin Bieber and One Direction. Read up on all the artists Ed Sheeran has written songs for...

Which other artists has Ed Sheeran written for?

Did Ed Sheeran write 'Shape of You' for Rihanna?

Ed Sheeran released 'Shape of You' in 2017, however the singer revealed that he originally thought he would offer the song to Rihanna. Ed opened up about the song saying that he planned to write some songs for other artists and thought 'Shape of You' would be good for Rihanna, however as he came up with the lyrics, he revealed he didn't think she would sing them, so he kept it for himself.

NOW WATCH: Ed Sheeran answers the Internet's rhetorical questions

Did Ed Sheeran write a song for Perrie Edwards?

Yes, Ed has co-written Perrie Edwards debut solo single, the song is called 'Forget About Us', and was released on 12th April 2024.

You can hear hits from Ed Sheeran on Hits Radio!
